_comment: Created by ianb on 01/08/2014 12:53:31 using v2.1
title: How has the successful treatment rate of opiate drug users changed over time?
analysis_commentary: The number of opiate drug users aged between 18 and 75 undergoing successful completion of drug treatment increased by 29.8% between January 2010 and December 2011, rising from 6.6% to 8.6% of all users in treatment. Performance then dipped slightly between January and December 2012, dropping by 0.4 percentage points to 8.2% of opiate drug users being successfully treated. Overall, the number of opiate drug users undergoing treatment in England dropped from 168,268 people in 2010 to 156,614 people in 2012.
data_source: National Drug Treatment Monitoring System, Public Health Outcomes Framework indicators
